website_summaries.verdict: The best starter bow for kids on the market, this is ready to use right away, with no tuning needed.
pros: Comes tuned and ready to use right out of the box
draw that is easy for children to handle
Draw weight can be adjusted if necessary
cons: Nock point may be set too high initially, requiring adjustment

customer_reviews.title: Does not have a let-off!
customer_reviews.text: This bow does not have a let-off! The whole point of the cam/pulley system in a compound bow is so that all the pull weight lets off at full draw. Meaning a 10 pound pull weight (normal for this bow) drops to only 2-3 pounds at the end of the pull. This lets the archer hold steady, aim, and release accurately and consistently. Learning how to shoot on this bow will force a shooter to learn recurve bow mechanics - which isn’t a bad thing, but is for the wrong kind of bow.
customer_reviews.author: John Wei

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This bow is perfect for my 9 year old daughter! She got it for Christmas (thanks for shipping a replacement one so quickly as the first arrived damaged) and was able to go out and start shooting immediately! The bow was accurate and set where she could start shooting right away. I love that Genesis makes an affordable bow for left handed people. I also love that this bow will grow with her. She and I were both able to take turns shooting her bow while teaching her how to properly stand, aim, and fire. Great bow! Thank you Genesis for making such a great bow at such a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Dempster

customer_reviews.title: It will allow two keyed padlocks (as required by archery rules) and has nice straps to secure the bow as well as arrow ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the approved competition bow for our son's middle school archery club. It is EXACTLY what the school offers the students to shoot with. He LOVES his bow; do NOT skimp on a cheap case... the plastic case with yellow hinges is also what the majority of archers carry. It will allow two keyed padlocks (as required by archery rules) and has nice straps to secure the bow as well as arrow holders. He even tosses his forearm guard and glove in. BEFORE YOU INVEST, MAKE SURE YOU KNOW WHICH HAND YOUR CHILD SHOOTS WITH!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Terrific bow for the beginner my son is using it in school for archery competitions
customer_reviews.author: JCrane

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10yr old daughter, who recently made the archery team & she loves it! We paired it with a case, also purchased on Amazon & its a perfect setup. She initially complained that the strings hurt her fingers when she drew back, but a week or so later she must have gotten use to it, because she said it "wasn't that bad now". I suspect that any bow would likely have the same issue for a child. Anyhow, she loves the bow & is doing well with it (except for the part where she set her target up on my adirondack chair for practice...grrr! lol!)
customer_reviews.author: Karen from NC

customer_reviews.title: Great looking bow!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking bow. My soon was really pleased to get this. It looks very nice, especially for a start out bow for my 16 year old. It shoots far for practicing, but by the specs, it's not good for actual hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No let off or accessories
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like the fact that it had no let off. Yes, it's only 20lbs, but a smaller person has difficulty holding that weight while aiming. I got a 30-70lb bow with a 75% let off, so at 30lbs, you're only holding 8lbs while aiming. The 30lb bow is stronger and there's lots of room for growth.
customer_reviews.author: Glock

customer_reviews.title: Great niece loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my great niece who is taking archery in school. It arrived on time. She loves it. I think the bow was set at 20 lbs but the one she uses at school is set at 15. She said it was easy to follow the included directions to set her bow tension.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat a Genesis!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to give away as door prizes at our youth Pheasants Forever event. We have been familiar with and used Genesis bows for years and they are great for beginners to learn on. The extra bonus is that if they choose to get involved in NASP down the road, they have their bow for that too!
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Great bow
customer_reviews.text: I am a NASP coach, so of course this is the only bow for my 8yr old son! It is the 3rd one we own now (plus one 'Pro'). Never had a single problem with any of them except having to re-glue 1 nock. Really haven't serviced them aside from an occassiinal waxing of strings and cable. Great all around buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Filograsso

customer_reviews.title: Archery girls!
customer_reviews.text: I actually ordered 2 of these for my girls. 1 of them was not the correct color but a simple phone call and they expedited a new one to me no charge (as long as I returned the incorrect one within 30 days) it was correct and arrived in 2 days. Very happy with quality fit and finish
customer_reviews.author: John Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great starter bow. Excellent craftsmanship. My son, daughter and I used this one together. My son is 14 and earned his Archery merit badge using this bow. It's easy to pull back, yet has power to send the arrows where they should be hitting. My daughter tried it. She's 11. You can adjust it to lower the draw weight. I took this bow to a Boy Scout camp and most of the boys participating in Archery, used this bow and loved it. Great investment without having to pay over a 1,000.00 on a high performance bow. I would say this one is just fine for beginner to intermediate.
customer_reviews.author: TRFBTop Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Equipment for Beginning Archers
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bow. This is his first year in archery in 7th grade and he used this at the National competition! Maybe it's the bow, maybe it's his sheer talent. It could be both. I like to think that this bow has helped him become more confident in his skills since it has performed well and he has not any any issues with it. I would highly recommend this for beginning archers.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Good bow for great price for NASP
customer_reviews.text: Bow is great. Good looking and functions well. Took my son to archery nationals this year! My only complaint is the center rest and string and cable don’t last very long. I would definitely buy a higher quality string and cable if buying for NASP program.
customer_reviews.author: Ty6897

customer_reviews.title: Well satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: For it's purpose in the school archery program, exactly what we needed. Did need to adjust it's strength down for our 9 year old granddaughter, but works fine. And the color choice was hers. And Amazon had the best price by far. Well satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ohioan

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for competing.
customer_reviews.text: Love this bow! We bought this for our son to have his own bow instead of using the schools and it has made a big difference in his accuracy. He loves it. For state competition they will tape the back with the camo lines. Just be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Wade

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't meet competition requirements
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bow for my son for use on his high school competition team. Unfortunately, the camo does not meet competition requirements. We had to paint it. Also, the metal nock is also not allowed. We found these two things out too late - so he wasn't able to use this bow in his first two meets, and wound up with a lower score. It would be helpful it this non-compliance was disclosed in the description.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sliwicki

customer_reviews.title: I love this bow for teaching because I can take it ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a certified 4-H archery instructor. I love this bow for teaching because I can take it up and down for a range of students. I am a petite lady and so this bow at it's highest is perfect for me.... but I can take my nephews who are just learning and they can have a go on it too. It doesn't have the bells and whistles, those you can add if you want. But if you want a solid, hearty, bow for youth, campers, beginners... THIS
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B

customer_reviews.title: bow
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our daughter for Christmas, and it came promptly. For clarification this bow is not purple, but rather a kind of "hot/dark pink" color. I do not think boys would be into this color. We knew what color it was before ordering it, my daughter did not care for the pale pink and white bow. The bow pull weight is easily adjustable, and we like the bow. My daughter had already used a bow of this brand in her 4H club. Even small adults, or people with weak arms would be able to use this bow.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Great Bow - Fun
customer_reviews.text: I am a traditional archer but I got my NASP cert so I could start a program at my school. This bow is great, easy to adjust draw for any shooter. Lots of fun to shoot, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bow
customer_reviews.text: Our twelve year old used a bow when she was at camp and wanted one for Christmas. I contacted the staff and the recommended this one as many different ages may use it. It’s exactly what she wanted. Don’t forget to order the arrows and a target!
customer_reviews.author: Rostie

customer_reviews.title: Got this for My 9 yr old she is in ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for My 9 yr old she is in archery at school and this is the only brand and type they can have to use in the archery club and for competition but couldn't find a girl color around here anywhere ! So when I saw this one on here I was so excited! But even more so when I saw my daughters face it was priceless! So worth it!
customer_reviews.author: James & Jennifer Champion

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bow
customer_reviews.text: Great quality bow. My son uses it on a daily basis and it has held up great after 11 months of use. It is the official NASP bow, so if your child is on his/her school archery team it can be used.
customer_reviews.author: J Haynes

customer_reviews.title: they both love their bow
customer_reviews.text: my 2 sons are in the NASP league, they both love their bow. the white camo finish is very nice, favorite of most people out at the competitions.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my son to be used with ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son to be used with his archery team. He was a brand new archer and after a few back and forth issues with receiving the correct item we finally got the right one and it works perfectly. My son is able to shoot well and it fits his frame and arm length as it is supposed to (15 year old boy).
customer_reviews.author: Mika Mosier

customer_reviews.title: Great bow.
customer_reviews.text: No issues, works great. My son used it in the NASP state competition. Since the bow is camouflage, for competition we did have to put tape on the site window so he couldn't use the pattern for a site reference.
customer_reviews.author: Woobird

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Daughter shoot archery in school, this is the exact bow used is school just better color choices. These bows are quality
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Clark

customer_reviews.title: Nice bow
customer_reviews.text: I love this bow. I'm able to shoot accurately with it and doesn't take a lot of strength to draw it. My mom can draw this bow and she's in her 70's. I'm sure it would be a great bow for young learners too. It's easy to adjust the pull. I highly recommend this bow for young and old alike.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H.

customer_reviews.title: His favorite Birthday Present!
customer_reviews.text: My son received it as a birthday gift. He used the same Bow at Boy Scout Summer Camp. He won the Camp Competition for the 2nd year in a row.
customer_reviews.author: PVR

customer_reviews.title: Great for new archers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my niece who is on a school archery team. She absolutely loves it. Great way for kids to get into the sport
customer_reviews.author: Jonny84

customer_reviews.title: Solid, and adjustable weight!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent first bow for my nine year old! Great american company! and they offer maintenance kits and accessories like fishing reals and mounts on their web site!
customer_reviews.author: sonyman

customer_reviews.title: Great bow
customer_reviews.text: Great bow. Bought it for my daughter a few years ago. She's in a Genesis archery league. Been using it for four or five leagues now with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Bow!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bow for my son, he is interested in Archery. Great Bow, great for beginners. I would recommend to anyone who is just starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Great starter compound bow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bow for my 12-year-old stepson as his first starter bow. He loves it. The pull weight is perfect for him and the draw length is just right. Now if only he can dial in his aim...
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Zombies beware
customer_reviews.text: Picked up this bow as a beginning for me with intention to pass it to my daughter when she is able to pull it. It's a solid performer an adjustable 10-20# draw weight (no-letoff). The riser has all the connection points for arrow rest, sight, stabilizers, etc. As an entry-level bow I love it and expect that it will be good for me as I build my skills and be a great hand-down to my daughter in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: P. B. Terry

customer_reviews.title: ... this for my 10yr old and it fits her great. It's a well built bow that will grow ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10yr old and it fits her great. It's a well built bow that will grow her and lets her stick an arrow at more than 10yrds.
customer_reviews.author: gerryv

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: My son really loves it. The only bow allowed to be used at his school and for competition.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdi

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner youth
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner bow for my 9 yr old. Very adjustable. Wish I knew there was no place for a stabilizer though as I bought a small one for it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Super beginning bow.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bow for my daughter's birthday. According to her: "I love it, it's great". Upon asking what there is to love about this bow, she replied that the draw is a good amount of weight for beginners and the weight of the bow is perfect. With that, I am satisfied that this was a very good purchase. As my daughter increases her experience I am sure we will be back to look at bows for advanced and expert level archers. thanks,
customer_reviews.author: Walt Nalli

customer_reviews.title: Nice bow, great for kids
customer_reviews.text: This bow is used in the school archery program. It's well made and shoots like a dream, It can be dialed up or down for power and can be set crazy light for smaller kids. The really neat thing is that I can shoot it too. NOTE: if you've got a very small child they now make a mini version...(I can't remember the name) that is physically lighter to hold up. This bow is kind of heavy for smaller kids.
customer_reviews.author: ILoveWood

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bow came in on time for Christmas for my daughter. Bow is beautiful and very accurate. My daughter shoots competitively and her scores have gone up since having her own bow.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Presnell

customer_reviews.title: Great bow
customer_reviews.text: The produce itself was great, however it did not come with a key to adjust it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bryant

customer_reviews.title: I love it for me as well though
customer_reviews.text: Heavy for my 9-year old, but she can control this nonetheless. For smaller children, you will need something to protect their inner arm...the arm guards don't cut it, so even an old tube sock will do (once you cut off the toes, as the arrows rub on my daughter's inside slow (guards wouldn't allow her to bend her arm). I love it for me as well though...love the fact that one bow works for everyone in the family!
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Constructed Bow
customer_reviews.text: My 12YO granddaughter wanted this for Christmas. Quality is good. Too cold to try it out yet. She picked this one because she has shot the same make of bow.
customer_reviews.author: gbnpp05

customer_reviews.title: Great Bow; Purchased for my son's School Archery Team
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! My 12 year-old son, who is the height of most 10 year-olds, has no problem with this bow. He is on a traveling archery team and we had to specifically purchase a Genesis Original for his school's team. He loves the white camo, because he stands out, so he says. :)
customer_reviews.author: TFM

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Genesis bow is the official bow for NASP. Affordable and is a decent product, but you get what you pay for (quality)
customer_reviews.author: Jeepgirl5900

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bow for cost! Looks very good & truly great quality for price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bow hits the target with value and quality!
customer_reviews.text: This bow is a great value for the money compared to other bows made for beginners! My son found it easy to use and he’s improving his scores in competition matches!
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son for Christmas and he loves it. Super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Bullseye
customer_reviews.text: Great for a first time student of archery. My 12 year old son has no issues using it, and loves the orange color.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bow, got a left hand one for my 10 year old daughter, she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Blackmore

customer_reviews.title: Great bow but for price should come with at least starter arrows
customer_reviews.text: Wish it came with arrows case and bow are great durability
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Herrod

customer_reviews.title: Nice , easy.
customer_reviews.text: Son took second place with this bow out of the box with only a couple hours of handling at the local bowhunters festival.
customer_reviews.author: eloise chrobak

customer_reviews.title: Have fun. Be safe. Play outdoors
customer_reviews.text: My son is in 7th grade and on archery team I bought him a used bow same brand and he and his team won state championship this year. Next month we travel to Kentucky for national title so all his hard work needed a reward so I bought him this new Guinness bow he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Cory Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great starting bow.
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old is very happy with this bow. Easy to adjust and ready to shoot out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: shawn s

customer_reviews.title: Works great she loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter's archery team. Works great she loves it! Meets all requirements of the competitions.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Nephew love it!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew uses it for his Archery Team at school. Very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Good bow
customer_reviews.text: Good now. Purchased as a gift. He will grow into it
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy use
customer_reviews.text: I love this bow!! I am a 27 year old female who doesn't have much strength. This bow is easy to use and light enough to hold for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Miccia

customer_reviews.title: The bow is great
customer_reviews.text: The bow is great however ordered LH Lemon and Amazon mailed RH Pink Lemonade. Got a replacement and the second bow was correct but took two weeks to get a bow.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES R.

customer_reviews.title: Decent starter or camp bow
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good "camp" bow. I put a sight on it to help my daughter's shooting, and it did help at the beginner level, but this bow will never be part of any competition shoots she enters. The only reason I give it 4 stars (vs. 5) is that she progressed out of this bow's capabilities within the first season of shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I wanted my son to have his own bow for the NASP program. These are surprisingly nice bows. I can understand why the NASP program adopted them as the standard. If your child is in this program, I recommend getting them their own. It's all about consistency. Practicing and competing with the same equipment is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Turner

customer_reviews.title: Archery bow
customer_reviews.text: High quality bow, perfect for my granddaughter who is 9.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R. Ledoux

customer_reviews.title: The Standard for youth bows
customer_reviews.text: The standard bow used for youth competitions. Maybe a bit pricier than other bows, but it will last longer and have higher resale, making it a less costly bow than other less expensive bows.
customer_reviews.author: SadieRocks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bow for my wife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my wife. She has become very accurate very quickly shooting it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: A Great Bow
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bow. It's a great beginner's bow with room to expand.
customer_reviews.author: N. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: NASP bow, great program for schools.
customer_reviews.text: Students that use their own bows tend to work harder and focus more in practice. Great investment for your child or grandchild.
customer_reviews.author: Rand

customer_reviews.title: great for all ages
customer_reviews.text: These bows are fantastic. Easy to adjust strength for different users. My kids love them and I can use them too
customer_reviews.author: Trago Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great bow!
customer_reviews.text: This was the brand my grandson needed for archery in school. Well made, accurate, and well built! Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for having fun
customer_reviews.text: Great bow for having fun. Kids enjoy shooting it and it works well for adults as well without having to make any adjustments. Teaches the fundamentals without the stress of a stronger hunting bow.
customer_reviews.author: AJO

customer_reviews.title: Best youth bow available at any price
customer_reviews.text: The folks at Mathews make great products, and this youth bow is no exception to that rule. My 13 year old son shoots 50 to 100 arrows per day, and just LOVES this bow. The quality of construction are superb, and the bow is easily adjusted and maintained. This is an excellent purchase for any youth archer, or a woman who is just beginning to enjoy the sport.
customer_reviews.author: LCR

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product at a low price!
customer_reviews.text: I love the bow. I got one because I wanted to shoot with my oldest daughter. The price for the bow on Amazon is very hard to beat. The prices are easily $175 and up everywhere else. Also you can't out grow one of these bows. My daughter has had one for a couple years now and has made it to Worlds through the NASP program in the schools.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: this is a great recreational bow
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what to add that hasn't already been said, but the whole family can shoot this bow, and actually quite well. The ease of draw weight adjustment, as well as well documented tuning techniques, this is a great recreational bow.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sevier

customer_reviews.title: Easily adjustable, and perfectly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 10 year old daughter. The cam is simple to adjust, and the grip is comfortable. The bolt rest is a bit fragile, but with some care, I think it will last. The frame is obviously well made, and I can assume that we will get a lifetime of use out of this bow.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Bow
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 9yr old daughter. She loves it! Easy for any beginner or good quality Bow
customer_reviews.author: Christine Duffy

customer_reviews.title: High quality, easy to use fits everyone.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bow for target archery. Easily generates interest for the whole family. We are having a great time with it and highly recommend this to anyone interested in learning archery or just having fun.
customer_reviews.author: karlen

customer_reviews.title: Great Bow for archery
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bow for youth or an adult. It can be used for competition and just shooting in the back yard by the family. This is the fifth Genesis bow our family has purchased. They come ready to use, but can be upgraded with sights, stabilizers and custom rests. Great product for the money!
customer_reviews.author: C Tynch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm just starting out and this is the perfect bow for beginners. I tried looking for one like this in stores and they were all for children. Being an adult woman it was tough to find a bow to start out with that I was able to pull back. Trust me its worth every penny. I was at a sporting goods store shortly after I purchased this bow and it was $30 more in the store!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Williams

customer_reviews.title: We love the quality and color of this bow
customer_reviews.text: We love the quality and color of this bow. We did however return it and get the Genesis Mini bow. This one was too big and had too heavy of a draw for our 6 year old girl!
customer_reviews.author: hslice57

customer_reviews.title: My bow didn’t come with a cable slide
customer_reviews.text: When I was shooting, it caused the string to wear. Overall it’s a great bow.
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great archery bow
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this for school archery. Great bow. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: JoannieM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my son. He uses it constantly and likes it. No complaints here
customer_reviews.author: Franhp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  bow for NASP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bow for NASP. Arrived just as promised. My kid loves it!
customer_reviews.author: ABE

customer_reviews.title: The bow is of great quality. Very happy about this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was very impressive. The bow is of great quality. Very happy about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G

customer_reviews.title: Shoots straight and steady
customer_reviews.text: My son moved to number one in his age group, thanks to having his own bow that shoots straight and steady. Great for school age archery team.
customer_reviews.author: john WL

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: fantastic bow. A lot of fun and very durable. Friends of mine bought their own after watching me demonstrate how accurate this bow can shoot. It allowed me to practice the fundamentals that I have used on other bows. Even though I have since started shooting a (at my full draw) 55 pound recurve bow, I still pick up my genesis bow and shoot it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard Pichette

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My sons absolutely fell in love with it. We did some research and decided to buy this bow. I am happy to say that it meets our expectations. Very good quality and performance. I am writing this review after they have used it for some time and rate it as five star.
customer_reviews.author: Anbar

customer_reviews.title: It's comfortable in hand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bow for myself. It's comfortable in hand, adjustable draw weight, not heavy. For me, as a beginner, has been great for getting the feel and technique without too much craziness going on.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Ruthstrom

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my 14 year-old son, and the whole family
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our son for Christmas. He's really into archery. Easy to use for all of us... different sizes and ages. Although it was a bit expensive, we'd get it again. The yellow also turned out to be very cool.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great boy that will last for years.
customer_reviews.text: A great item for beginners or seasoned youth archers an is compliant for all school sanctioned archery programs. The price was also much better than the big box sports stores.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 65 and find this bow easy to use and helpful for upper body exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Fayegene

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for daughter for her archery class. Love it. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for new young shooters.
customer_reviews.text: Genesis bow is easily adjustable for not so strong grandkids. After adjustment is made you can sneak a turn on the 2 limb screws so your kid has to work harder and get stronger and doesn't know it. Am having fun using it. Installed new arrow rest and sight to match my larger compound bow. Did take some modifications. Bow shoots well at 10 yards that's all the room I have in the basement for learning before going out in the spring. The kid has put 6 arrows in a 2 inch circle. He feels good and that is what it is all about. Self esteem.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this bow for an archery group at school. Nice little bow. He will be able to use it for quite a while. Good value for the price. He really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Bingewatcher

customer_reviews.title: NASP approved
customer_reviews.text: Great bow, my son just started shooting NASP archery for his school. This bow will could last him years.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great bow!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect bow for kids. I bought this for a 10year girl, the draw weight is very adjustable and the price on Amazon is much lower than anywhere else. I've seen the bow's go for $225, I paid $149 for this one.
customer_reviews.author: DaveWGentry

customer_reviews.title: Bowie
customer_reviews.text: My son is shooting better already. Top notch bow for the price.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Robles

customer_reviews.title: It's the bomdiggity.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a neighbor girl, senior in high school taking archery. She is well pleased with this bow. She said it's the bomdiggity.
customer_reviews.author: Old Texan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My 5th grader is in archery club and this how is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shells

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for sport. Can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for learning to shoot the bow. A lot of fun for my wife and 11yr old daughter. Really easy to use. No hassles. No complications. It just works! Really a lot of fun and a quality bow. Maybe not the best "hunting" bow due to lower power but that's not why we bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Dye

product_meta.title: Genesis Original Bow
product_meta.description: Genesis bows are the first compound bows designed to eliminate let-off and specific draw length requirements, making it the perfect choice for beginner and intermediate archers of all ages, sizes and athletic abilities. They're a great introduction to the sport of archery because beginners won't develop bad habits caused by an ill-fitting bow. The Original bow can be adjusted as the archer grows and develops their skills. Details: Zero let-off design; Light draw weight comes standard at 20 lbs and can be safely lowered to 10 lbs - all you need is a 3/16" hex wrench (provided) to adjust draw weight; Covers all standard draw lengths ranging between 15"-30"; Machined 6061-T6 aluminum riser, aluminum cam and idler wheel; Composite limbs; Cable guard; Molded competition grip; Riser is drilled and tapped for standard accessories; 0% let-off; 35 1/2" axle-to-axle; 7 5/8" brace height.
feature_bullets: Official bow of the National Archery in the Schools Program (NASP).
Great starter bow for archers of all ages, sizes and athletic abilities.
With no specific draw length requirement, kids can't outgrow this bow.
Includes a machined 6061-T6 aluminum riser, aluminum cam and idler wheel, sturdy composite limbs and high-strength bowstrings – all made in the USA.
Built with single-cam technology, there are no tuning issues, less recoil, less noise and more accurate shooting.
